intro: Monnina hirta, commonly known as hairy monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive leaf and flower structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, while its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red. Monnina hirta is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert or scrubland habitats.
